headline: Bitcoin Consolidates as Markets Await Direction

sections.the_session:
• Bitcoin held steady around $92,274 through the US session, shedding just 0.3% in a day marked more by indecision than conviction — the kind of sideways drift that often precedes larger moves, though direction remains anyone's guess.

• Ethereum managed a modest 0.4% gain to $3,338, outperforming Bitcoin for the second consecutive session as traders rotated into the second-largest asset ahead of anticipated network developments.

• Total market capitalisation slipped 0.2% to $3.25 trillion while BTC dominance held firm at 56.7%, suggesting capital isn't fleeing crypto so much as sitting on its hands.

• Liquidations remained muted across major exchanges, with neither bulls nor bears willing to press their bets — a marked contrast to the volatility that characterised early December trading.
sections.the_macro:
• Treasury yields ticked higher as traders positioned ahead of tomorrow's FOMC minutes release, with the 10-year touching 4.42% — a level that has historically capped crypto rallies when sustained.

• The dollar index strengthened 0.2% against major currencies, applying modest pressure to risk assets including crypto, though the move lacked the conviction to trigger meaningful repositioning.

• European Central Bank officials struck a cautious tone on rate cuts at Davos side meetings, reinforcing the higher-for-longer narrative that has kept institutional crypto allocations in check since the new year.

• Oil prices firmed on Red Sea shipping disruption concerns, a reminder that geopolitical risk premiums can shift capital flows in unexpected directions.
sections.the_macro_title: Fed Minutes Loom Over Risk Assets

north_america.name: North America
north_america.content:
• US spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded estimated net inflows of $58 million on Tuesday, with BlackRock's IBIT capturing the lion's share at approximately $95 million while Grayscale's GBTC continued its steady bleed of $42 million — the familiar pattern of institutional rotation rather than fresh capital.

• The SEC remained quiet on pending spot Ethereum ETF applications, though the January 25 deadline for Franklin Templeton's filing approaches with no indication the agency plans to engage constructively.

• Canadian crypto exchange Coinsquare announced expanded stablecoin offerings following regulatory clarity from Ontario securities regulators, positioning itself to capture institutional flow that US platforms cannot service.

• Texas energy regulators opened public comment on proposed guidelines for crypto mining load flexibility programs, a potential template for other states grappling with grid integration questions.

central_america.name: Central America
central_america.content:
• El Salvador's Bitcoin holdings remained unchanged at approximately 2,846 BTC according to government disclosures, with President Bukele's administration notably quieter on accumulation announcements since the IMF loan negotiations intensified.

• Guatemala's central bank issued guidance clarifying that remittance providers may integrate stablecoin rails for settlement purposes, stopping short of retail crypto endorsement but opening a meaningful corridor for the $18 billion annual remittance market.

• Panama's crypto regulatory framework remains in legislative limbo following December's committee delays, with banking industry lobbying reportedly behind the stalled progress.

south_america.name: South America
south_america.content:
• Brazil's securities regulator CVM published draft rules for crypto asset fund structures, potentially opening the door for pension funds to gain exposure through regulated vehicles — a market worth watching given Brazil's $1.2 trillion pension pool.

• Argentine peso-denominated stablecoin trading volumes on local exchanges rose 8% week-over-week as inflation expectations ticked higher despite Milei administration austerity measures, the familiar hedge demand pattern reasserting itself.

• Colombia's financial superintendent met with Binance representatives in Bogotá to discuss compliance framework requirements, signalling the exchange's continued push for formal market access in Latin America's third-largest economy.

• Venezuelan peer-to-peer Bitcoin volumes held steady near six-month highs as the bolívar's parallel market rate deteriorated further, with LocalBitcoins successor platforms capturing the bulk of activity.

image_keywords: Manhattan skyline, golden sunset, Hudson River, warm evening light
